data.name: Saison Lamoille
data.description: A slightly lower alcohol version of the classic farmhouse style. Hazy golden beer with notes of fruit, spice, and funk.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: French & Belgian-Style Saison
style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

data.name: Saison Le Coq
data.description: Traditional Belgian farmhouse ale brewed with rye, caraway and trace of onion. Four months of barrel aging imparted wild yeasts, adding complexities to the solid dry finish. We cellared this beauty for seven months, allowing it to naturally carbonate.

Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

data.name: Saison Le Printemps
data.description:
Le Printemps has nettle tips added post fermentation for the gentle 'cut grass' aroma of Springtime. 
Combined with subtle citrus zest and spicy hop character, this beer is hugely refreshing.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

data.description: Sweet and sharp citrus with peppery flavors of traditional farmhouse yeast.

data.name: Saison Lillis
data.description: The latest in our rotating saison series. Notes of cantaloupe, watermelon, and bubblegum. Dry hopped with El Dorado.

data.name: Saison Locale #3
data.description: A farmhouse ale made with orange peel, coriander and lavender and tarragon grown in Brewmaster Brian's garden.

data.name: Saison Locale No. 13
data.description:
Saisons are a traditional Belgian farmhouse ale brewed with a combination of herbs and spices that the farmers currently had on hand. They are
intended to be crisp and thirst-quenching for the farmhands. Notes of citrus and clove spice are prominent. We keep with this tradition
and change up the fruits and spices we use for each beer in the series. For batch no. 13, we used lemongrass, pink peppercorn and galangal root.

Saison no. 4 earned us our first medal - it took home Silver at the 2014 Colorado State Fair!

data.name: Saison L’Ombre
data.description: A dark saison, brewed with a blend of edible flowers and herbs. Cool and refreshing, like shade from the summer sun.

data.name: Saison M
data.description: Saison M is a well-balanced confluence of Michigan agriculture with notes of lemon, pineapple, and resinous pine. Mild bitterness washes over the tongue before giving way to hints of oak and moderate acidity.

data.name: Saison Man
data.description: This long anticipated golden Belgian Ale is a 'Post Industrial Session Saison', brewed with Weyerman pilsen, rye, flaked wheat, flaked oats, spelt, and grains of paradise. We hopped this beer with Styrian Goldings and Czech Saaz to create a bitter and dry profile, then fermented this recipe with 2 farmhouse yeast strains and Drie Bretta to create spicy and light barnyard notes.

data.name: Saison Meer: Dandelion
data.description: This is our base saison that is brewed with Midwestern ingredients, including dandelions from our own yard.  It was fermented in oak barrels with our house culture.

data.name: Saison Meer: Gin Barrel & Dandelion
data.description: This is our base saison that is brewed with Midwestern ingredients, including dandelions from our own yard.  It was fermented in oak barrels with our house culture. After fermentation, most of the batch of Saison Meer: Dandelion was further aged in a gin barrel from Oppidan before bottling.

data.name: Saison Meer: Gin Barrel & Red Currant
data.nameDisplay: Saison Meer: Gin Barrel & Red Currant
data.description: Saison brewed with Midwestern ingredients, including Illinois red currants, and fermented in oak with a mixed culture before being blended with a version of the same base beer aged in a local gin barrel.

data.description: Saison brewed with Midwestern ingredients and fermented in oak with our mixed culture and then further aged with Indiana organic rhubarb.

data.name: Saison Memoir
data.description: This light ale is very dry, and is blended with our barrel-aged, wild-yeast fermented Saison. It brings soft peppercorn, bright lemon, and funk to the party.

data.name: Saison Noir
data.description: Saison Noir is a dark and earthy farmhouse ale, which we’ve brewed to signify the changing of the seasons.  Malted barley meets a French yeast to complement the deep, roasted notes with a fresh aroma. Saison Noir keenly balances its shadowy character with a rich and inviting presence. Let yourself be snared in its grasp.

data.name: Saison of the Western Ghats
data.description: French-style farmhouse ale. Light and spicy.

data.name: Saison Oscura
data.description: Based on the farmhouse ale style that is generally released in the spring or summer, we darkened the color with chocolate malt and boosted the alcohol to make it more warming. The result was a dark, mysterious beer that has a light body, subtle peppery spiciness, and hints of chocolate in the finish.

data.name: Saison Pamplemousse
data.description: Notes of pink peppercorn and clove compliment the citrusy nose, subdued esters, and balanced hop bite courtesy of Citra and Cascade.  Belgian Pilsner malt create a soft malt profile that makes this bright and effervescent grapefruit saison the perfect companion to warm sunny days.

data.name: Saison Phi
data.description: Saison with Rose Petal, Chamomile, Fennel & Oat Straw. "Flower Power" beer for Borefts Beer Festival 2017.

style.name: American-Style Sour Ale
style.description: American sour ales can be very light to black or take on the color of added fruits or other ingredients. There is no Brettanomyces character in this style of beer. Wood- and barrel-aged sour ales are classified elsewhere. If acidity is present it is usually in the form of lactic, acetic and other organic acids naturally developed with acidified malt in the mash or in fermentation by the use of various microorganisms including certain bacteria and yeasts. Acidic character can be a complex balance of several types of acid and characteristics of age. The evolution of natural acidity develops balanced complexity. Residual flavors that come from liquids previously aged in a barrel such as bourbon or sherry should not be present. Wood vessels may be used during the fermentation and aging process, but wood-derived flavors such as vanillin must not be present. In darker versions, roasted malt, caramel-like and chocolate-like characters should be subtle in both flavor and aroma. American sour may have evident full range of hop aroma and hop bitterness with a full range of body. Estery and fruity-ester characters are evident, sometimes moderate and sometimes intense, yet balanced. Diacetyl and sweet corn-like dimethylsulfide (DMS) should not be perceived. Chill haze, bacteria and yeast-induced haze are allowable at low to medium levels at any temperature. Fruited American-Style Sour Ales will exhibit fruit flavors in harmonious balance with other characters.

data.name: Saison Poire
data.description:
Saison Poire is an easy drinking and sustaining beer, rich in character and complexity. A deep golden hue, pour Poire gently from the bottle.

We combined Gladfield's pilsner malt with a small proportion of wheat, toffee and crystal malts. Three classic varieties of hops meld with candi sugar, dried pears and spices, and our super saison yeast.

A sweet aroma and full fruity flavour, the drinker is rewarded with a dry finish. Drink slowly to savour the flavour, and let the goblet warm in your hand.

data.name: Saison Prelude
data.description: This beer has four different hops set around a centrepiece Saison yeast. The spicy dry base is layered with rich ripe melon and bubblegum flavours, counterbalanced with a tart citrus finish.

data.name: Saison Renaud
data.description:
Sturdy farmhouse ale that was traditionally brewed in the winter, to be consumed throughout the summer months. Not so long ago it was close to being an endangered style, but over recent years there's been a massive revival; especially in the US. 

This is a very complex style; many are very fruity in the aroma and flavor. Look for earthy yeast tones, mild to moderate tartness. Lots of spice and with a medium bitterness. They tend to be semi-dry with many only having touch of sweetness.

data.name: Saison Rosé
data.description: A delicate blend of saisons, one aged in oak barrels, the other brewed with hibiscus flowers and co-fermented with chardonnay grape juice. Fruity, tart and dry, this lovely pale ruby ale will arrive just in time for summer and will delight both beer and wine drinkers alike.

data.name: Saison Rouge
data.description: This rustic red farmhouse ale incorporates a variety of grains including significant portions of flaked wheat and flaked oats to give body and offset the classic saison dry finish. Look for subtle but complex Belgian style yeast contributions of fruit, clove, and earthy – peppery notes.

data.name: Saison Rue
data.description: Saison Rue is an unfiltered, bottle conditioned, Belgian/French-style farmhouse ale. This is a beer of subtlety and complexity, with malted rye, spicy, fruity yeast notes, biscuit-like malt backbone, and a slight citrus hop character. With age, this beer will dry out and will become more complex with rustic notes of leather and earth from the contribution of a wild yeast strain. Being a Saison, Saison Rue is ambiguous unto itself as it is a different beer when fresh and when aged. We hope you enjoy it in all of its incarnations.
data.foodPairings: Scottish salmon tataki, roasted garlic chicken, endive salad, braised pear and a midweek date night with the one you love.

data.name: Saison Rustica
data.description:
Belgian-style Saison Brewed with Star Anise, Peppercorns and Fresh Local Lemongrass
Refreshingly light in body, yet full in flavor, Hardywood Saison Rustica combines the best of both worlds for a warm weather beer like no other. A delicate, yet vibrant beer, Saison Rustica’s citrusy lemongrass notes play together in perfect harmony with the prickly spice character from a blend of black, Szechuan and pink peppercorns and finishes with mellow licorice tones offered by freshly cracked star anise. At an approachable 4.5% alcohol, the quaffability of this beer is uncompromising.
Special thanks to David and Barbara from Village Garden for supplying the fresh local lemongrass for Saison Rustica.
data.foodPairings: Best with hard cheeses, steamed crustaceans and mollusks and blackened fish.

style.description: Beers in this category are golden to deep amber in color. There may be quite a variety of characters within this style. Generally: They are light to medium in body. Malt aroma is low to medium-low. Esters are medium to high in  aroma, while, complex alcohols, herbs, spices, low Brettanomyces character and even clove and smoke-like phenolics may or may not be evident in the overall balanced beer. Hop aroma and flavor may be at low to medium levels. Malt flavor is low but provides foundation for the overall balance. Hop bitterness is moderate to moderately assertive. Herb and/or spice flavors, including black pepper-like notes, may or may not be evident. Fruitiness from fermentation is generally in character. A balanced small amount of sour or acidic flavors is acceptable when in balance with other components. Earthy, cellar-like, musty aromas are okay. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill or slight yeast haze is okay. Often bottle conditioned with some yeast character and high carbonation. French & Belgian-Style Saison may have Brettanomyces characters that are slightly acidity, fruity, horsey, goaty and/or leather-like.

data.name: Saison Rustique
data.description: Saison d’inspiration belge, blonde, sèche aux parfums rustique de foin, d’herbes, d’houblon herbacé. Refermentée en bouteille.
